Stayed one night
review_text: We cannot say enough great things about this cozy little gem in the country! Ruby was instantly welcoming in her online responses and gave us privacy during our time at her place. So many simple, but thoughtful extras to welcome us... fresh apples on the kitchen table, snacks & water in the kitchenette, and bath necessities (soap, shampoo & conditioner, a first aid kit too!). The clip-clop of the Amish neighbors traveling up and down the road was especially sweet! We only stayed one night this time, so we didn't get to spend much time in the beautiful outdoor spaces she's created, but we'll definitely be back! Thank you, Ruby! :)

review_text:
My husband and I stayed at The Olde Wash House from July 6th through July 9th, 2023. We came to Lancaster to see Moses at Sight and Sound Theater, and Ruby and John's place was very convenient to the theater.
I can't say enough about the lovely little house and all of its personal touch! Ruby has it decorated so nicely. She had snacks, fresh fruit, and water in the fridge. Everything was spotless! The bed was so comfortable, and we slept very well. I wish my mattress at home was as comfy as Ruby's!
Ruby and her husband John are both so friendly too! Their kindness comes straight from the heart, and you can tell that they're so sincere. I honestly have to say that I have never seen two people work so hard, and so continuous in my life! They never stop!
I don't want to omit the lovely yard and grounds, and their Amish neighbors! It was delightful to watch them doing their daily chores. I was truly inspired. I'm running out of space, but I must mention Bravo, their Beautiful Dog! LOVE!

name: Elizabeth
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
May 2023
,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text: Ruby & John were incredibly warm and welcoming - and so was their adorable two-year old dog, Bravo. Sweet Bravo greeted us as soon as we pulled into the driveway with his non-stop wagging tail & huge smile. He's very calm and well-behaved! My sister and I had a wonderful evening and overnight of peace, quiet, and pure rest & relaxation after a long, busy day of visiting friends and family in Wilmington. The Olde Wash House was sooooo comfy!!! It's nestled on John & Ruby's large property of gorgeous trees, shrubs, & blooming flowers. There are many spots here and there to relax outdoors. I enjoyed a cold beer on the west-facing deck behind the Olde Wash House as the sun set behind a huge barn next door. The farm across the road had two or three roan (is that "blonde" in horse talk?) horses joyously frolicking in their pasture. The only sound was from merry birds fluttering from tree to tree and the occasional clip-clopping of horses hooves as Amish buggies ambled by. HEAVEN!!

Amish families live next door and across the street, with an Amish school 2 doors away. It was so pleasant to hear the clip-clopping of the horses pulling buggies. Ruby and her husband were warm, and available for any questions or needs I had. Thanks to you both! I plan to return in the fall to do more family research so I hope I'll find a couple open days again!

review_text: The Olde Wash House is a well appointed and detailed " cottage " that is uncluttered with a decor that is not inflated or overdone . It is evident that Ruby and John have taken the time to choose the appropriate furnishings and pieces for this space that are not only pleasing to the eye , but give you a sense of " home " and tranquility . Just outside the entry door is the inviting porch with comfy furnishing's and a lovely and peaceful water wheel in operation . Adjacent to the porch is a beautiful Cabana and a fire pit for your enjoyment . The owner's have recently added a lovely private deck to the back of this little gem that overlooks the fields of the adjacent Amish Farms . May we also mention with great emphasis how immaculate and clean this lovely " cottage " is kept from top to bottom ! We would be hard pressed to find a complaint about this Airbnb as it rates better than 5 stars on our list as we stopped booking hotels long ago whenever possible . We will be returning !

review_text:
From the moment that we arrived we knew that this was going to be a special treat.
Ruby & John have created a perfectly landscaped "welcome" to Lancaster County. The Olde Wash House is nestled amongst shade trees, perennial gardens, twinkling lights and historic farm houses. The private entry is lovely and the accommodations fabulous! The rooms are decorated beautifully, the bed - so comfortable, the fixtures all new and fit the space well. It really is a charming mix of old & new.
We woke each morning to cows and horses grazing in the fields nearby, and Amish children making their way to school, all while horses & buggies took families down the road. It was peaceful, lovely, and more than we had hoped for.
Ruby & John are thoughtful and kind hosts. It was a pleasure to meet them. We are so grateful for their hospitality and look forward another stay.

Seeing this place in person exceeded my expectations. The decor, the thoughtfulness behind certain details/accommodations just gave you this â€œfeel at homeâ€ kind of vibe.
Kitchen was well stocked with equipment if youâ€™re staying for a longer visit. While it was my first time in Pennsylvania, appreciated the maps and brochures left on the front table. Bed was super comfy and there was plenty of storage space for my clothes in the closet nearby. Ceiling fan above the bed was a surprise but a nice touch for Iâ€™m sure the hotter days. Bathroom was clean, and the added sanitary napkin dispenser on the wall is a smart idea. If I had to be picky, not a lot of counter top space in the bathroom so ladies that wear a lot of makeup or who have a lot of skin care products, just an fyi.
Canâ€™t forget about having a private garage in the city was a bonus! Walking distance to plenty of restaurants and shops. Felt safe; neighborhood was quiet.
Overall, would definitely stay here again!

The Barn is breathtaking. Every detail, from the barnwood, the layout, decor and craftmanship, you can see and feel the love and hardwork that went into making this peaceful haven.
If you want the best of both worlds: the energy and excitement of the city by day and the quite and tranquility at night.....The Barn on Fox Alley is the place to stay.

rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,
Â·

,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text:
Mostly, stay was nice. Home charming, surprisingly spacious (walls angled-obviously. Careful upstairs if youâ€™re tall). Beds comfy. Key lockbox & parking easy. Nice white towels. Hosts fast to respond to messages re: planning what to bring (coffee/creamer/etc). SURPRISES-strong mildew odor upon entry. I got used to it fairly quickly. If you have an allergy, you should know. I later saw other reviews mentioned it too.
Also framed signs re: rules, procedures. One says no food/drink in living areas. If you like coffee in bed or a drink on the couch to watch tv, itâ€™s a no-no.
Bold, though, is the sign of check out rules-not included on listing. Despite the $75 cleaning fee, guests are TOLD (not asked, no please) to take trash to the outside bin, wash/dry/put away dishes, strip beds, reset thermostats.
I am respectful of othersâ€™ property. I tidy up when leaving. But I never experienced this as an Airbnb guest or a guest anywhere. Pretty nervy of ppl profiting from a hospitality service.

review_text: This little A frame has a lot going for it with the location, quiet area, and style, but unfortunately, the VERY strong smell of mildew really made my stay not fun. I could smell it on my hair and clothes when I wasn't there and when I got home it took three hair washings to get the smell out. My suitcase, clothes, toiletry bag, etc took more effort to get the smell out. Washing my clothes didn't even work after the first washing. I have put off giving a review, because I don't like to give negative reviews, but I need to tell others. I'm sure the owners have tried to get the smell out because a dehumidifier and air purifier was running constantly. I'm surprised no one else had complained about it until several months prior. ğŸ¤” Sorry, but I could not recommend this place to anyone unless this was resolved.

We really enjoyed our stay in the A-frame. We have never been inside one, and my daughter thought it was amazing! She loved the loft area and spiral stairs. Everything was clean and so nicely decorated. We enjoyed making breakfast, watching Christmas movies, and sitting in the lounge areas hanging out. The bedroom was very spacious. The location was close to many things we enjoyed. The owners were super responsive.
A few issues/suggestions:
-There was a musty smell on entry but we either got used to it or the dehumidifier took care of it.
-The house felt drafty in some areas so socks or slippers are a good idea for guests to bring.
-I felt that over $100 in fees at the end of checking out was very excessive. I had spent a lot of time researching places and comparing prices and settled on this one. It ended up being TWICE as much as the listing advertised. I was so tired of searching by that point that I booked it anyways, but those cleaning fees should just be included in the cost.

review_text:
This a really cute place in a great location, with lots of nice amenities like a fire pit and grill. About seven minutes to Dutch Wonderland, which is great when your kids need a nap break in the middle of the day. And easy access to downtown Lancaster and other attractions in the area.
The master bedroom is modern and large, complementing an upstairs loft. Given the design of the house, the loft room gets a lot of light in the morning when the sun comes up. So if youâ€™re sensitive to light, the master bedroom downstairs is better for shutting out light. The kitchen is sensibly stocked with the essentials, though it doesnâ€™t have more specialized items like muffin pans (we ended up making muffins in a casserole dish). The washer/dryer is very handy, as were the dehumidifier and extra air conditioning (it was 90+ every day we were there). We would definitely stay again!

Stayed one night
review_text: I was absolutely delighted to return to Martha's for the second time, and I must say, this charming residence truly feels like a home away from home. Its prime location, just a 5-minute stroll from school, makes it an ideal haven for students seeking convenience and comfort. Plus, a bowling alley with a restaurant serving exquisite sangria is just around the corner, providing the perfect spot to unwind with friends. And, if you're fortunate, you'll be greeted by the welcoming committee: a playful and affectionate puppy who loves attention and playtime. This cozy retreat offers everything you need to feel relaxed and at ease, complete with soft linens, plush furnishings, and a well-equipped kitchen that makes cooking a breeze. During our stay, we took full advantage of the beautiful weather and spent some quality time lounging in the patio chairs, soaking up the sun. I've already booked my next stay in a couple of weeks and am eager to make use of the grill and enjoy soaking in the sun!

name: Karen

April 2024
,
Â·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
I can think of only two items I'd add, if I were making suggestions. I'd add more, but I can't, because Martha's cottage had everything else we needed!
For a smaller cottage, the space was laid out to make use of just about every inch, so it didn't have a small-space feel to it. It was the perfect space for my husband and I to get a much needed break. We both slept like babies in the cozy bed, did NOT want to get out of the FABULOUS shower (I almost made us late checking out because it felt so good), and rather than eat in the living room to watch tv, we just turned it a little and it was perfect for viewing while we enjoyed our dinner at the kitchen counter.
Probably the only down-side was that it was chilly and windy, so it wasn't the best weather to walk across their foot bridge and sit by the stream. We're very much looking forward to another stay so we can do that, as well as enjoying cooking outside on the grill. Loved this place!

Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: I was able to find a place to park a couple doors up from the property so that was a great start. The street is busy but the Matilda suite is on the backside of the building and aside from a very occasional ambulance (due to the proximity of the property), it was extremely quiet and peaceful. There is an abundance of natural light from morning to sunset which was absolutely therapeutic. It is roughly a half mile walk to the Central Market, I didn't plan well and there were so many options, so carrying my goods back was a bit of a bear so if you plan to go to the market, bring a back back or cart - it will make things easier. The kitchen had exactly what I needed to make meals and they left some farm fresh eggs and a couple of micro brews as an added treat. Great coffee shops and unique retail shops were an easy 10-20 minute walk depending on where you want to go. The Belvedere Inn was about around the corner and had delicious food and drinks with friendly bartenders. I'll be back!

What a delightful property! The original architecture is amazing (Iâ€™m in love with the stairs). Shannon and Rich have created a quiet and cozy getaway that I would recommend in a heartbeat to friends & family.
As others mentioned, there were lots of thoughtful touches, from the bathrobes to the two local beers & small container of eggs in the fridge. It was nice and cool (central AC for the win!) and I loved all of the natural light through the windows. While I didnâ€™t use it, the fact that there was laundry in the basement was huge plus. Everything was incredibly clean, the bed was very comfortable, and the shower is truly the BEST. Seriously.
Shannon & Rich are very responsive, friendly, and helpful (and the welcome guide they created was fantastic!). You can tell theyâ€™ve put a lot of time and care into their properties, and Iâ€™m very excited to come back and stay again sometime.
Also, I grew up in the country and have lived in many cities (including Lancaster) and this was one of the quietest places Iâ€™ve stayed in. There were maybe a few times I heard a car, but it was very rare! I was so happy to come back after a busy day and be in complete silence.
Donâ€™t miss out on this stayâ€”it will be one of your favorites!

review_text: Rich and Shannon have done an absolutely stunning job restoring this old Victorian home. It is conveniently located on Duke Street, one of the main thoroughfares of the city, and this unit is located in the back of the home away from any street noise, and surrounded by greenery. Quick 10 minute walk to Lemon Street Market for groceries, or to other shops in downtown. The balcony is lovely for having morning coffee and breakfast, or an evening meal. The interior is spotlessly clean (I am a tough judge of cleanliness), with all the comforts of home provided and then some! There are so many thoughtful touches (well tended to plants, extra blankets, plush robes, etc.) that truly made our stay more than just another airbnb. The shower head/water pressure is amazing and spa-like. Check-in was easy, and communication with Rich and Shannon was always timely and helpful. For parking, another review suggested trying over by the nearby cemetery, and this worked perfectly for us as well (no permit required, and no time limit). I would without hesitation recommend

name: Lisa
rating_info:

,

,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text: We had a great stay at Rich and Shannon's place. We were just stopping through for one night, at the last minute, and they were vey accommodating! The space was drenched in light, which was very enjoyable, especially during this winter when we are forced to spend way more time indoors. The kitchen is well-equipped, with dishwasher and everything you need to prepare simple meals at home. There is only one TV, in the bedroom, but this was fine for us as we just watched it for a bit before bed. The apartment is in a wonderful location, right in the downtown. There's an organic grocery store a few blocks away to pick up whatever you may need food-wise, and an adorable Swedish candy shop right around the corner. Most things were not open, because it was a Sunday and of course, Covid, but we still enjoyed wandering around the cute town. Parking is a bit complicated, as much of the street parking requires a permit, so make sure to read the instructions provided by Rich and Shannon for where/when you can park safely to avoid getting ticketed. You could hear the other people in the building above you and when guests were coming up or down the stairs, but it was very quiet at night. Overall, we had a great stay and would stay again.

It's a beautiful apartment and the hosts are super great but... it has a couple of things that
we didn't like. First of all since it's on a second floor we were told that we may be able to hear footsteps above us, but that was far from true. Not only you can listen to everything other guests do above you, but we had people walking with heels and even 2 kids jumping up and down and galloping above our bedroom when we were trying to sleep. it's not the hosts fault, but I did find this kind of disappointing considering we asked them about the noise. Second thing is since it's located in the city, you can hear cars.That wouldn't be terrible if only people didn't blast their speakers all the time. And there's (Im guessing a neighbor?) a person that plays the LOUDEST music at 8:30 am every.single.day. we stayed for 14 days and that was enough, because it's super super loud. so if you're Looking for an extremely quiet place, this is not it.
Apart from that, the place is cool. Stylish and comfortable, it just wasn't what we were expecting. Most of the problems are NOT the hosts fault, but it did kind of ruined the experience for us.

Stayed over a week
review_text: We had a wonderful stay and would love to give the Matilda flat 10+ stars if we could. The high ceilings and natural light that came from the windows enabled us to relax and take in the peacefulness of Lancaster. The location was amazing - there was a lot you can walk to and when it was too hot to stroll, it was easy to find parking and take off in your car 5 minutes away to the shopping areas and mainstream restaurants. We were 10 min walking distance to Central Market and would often duck out during lunch hours (since we went here to just have a quick getaway from the city!) and pick up local coffee, fresh bread, and lunch meals to take back to the apartment. Rich + Shannon's recommendations outside of the area were also spot on. We had a great time driving to Lancaster's Central Park + enjoyed Pine View Dairy for fresh goods off the farm. Everything was neat, tidy, and thoughtful and Rich + Shannon were always extremely responsive - we're looking forward to another opportunity to stay here again and can't thank the hosts enough for making this such a warm and welcoming experience.

review_text: This home is full of character, while being very clean and functional. This was our second stay there and this time we were in the Matilda apartment - which was new for us. The back dining/living room had windows on three sides and we were worried that it might be cold in February. However, the heater worked perfectly and we were warm throughout - especially when the sun shone in. The kitchen was very new, functional and everything worked. The queen bed was comfortable and the bedroom very quiet. The bedroom had artistic finishes, gloriously high-ceilings and architectural surprises that made it fun. Shower was powerful and there was a luxurious sink in the bathroom. This apartment does have five stairs leading from the bedroom area to the bathroom floor and then the kitchen so one has to be careful. It was a delightful place to stay - a great experience. We hope to be back!

Rich and Shannonâ€™s Matilda apartment is absolutely wonderful. Highly recommend. I hope to stay again one day.
Check in is very easy. Shannon is kind, professional and very responsive.
The home was sparkling clean and spacious. The shower and bathroom were great too. The bed was â€œto die forâ€ comfortable, I loved it and slept well.
The little things matter so much, Rich and Shannonâ€™s binder of Lancaster recommendations is pure gold!!! Because of their recs, I took my colleagues to the Belvedere Inn and Luca for dinner, both hits! I also got takeout at Sa La Thai and saw a documentary at the funky Zoetropolis. Their recs filled my whole trip and I didnâ€™t even get to go to the Axe Throwing bar (!!) and the Lord of the Rings coffee and book shop (!). Pro Tip: Read their binder :)
Rich and Shannon have also put loads of fun books all over the apartment, books that are actually fun to pick up and read for a bit. I read many thoughtful interviews with famous women and enjoyed flipping through 1000 places to see before you die ;)
If you need a nice, quiet, comfortable apartment during your stay in Lancaster, you cannot go wrong with the Matilda apartment. Youâ€™ll have a peaceful happy stay with tons of fun places all within walking distance.
Thank you Rich and Shannon!

May 2023
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: The host did amazing job and the cleaning crew did great! The decore was gorgeous and the remodeling of this place has a boho vibe. The location was great overall. There is a parking garage in the back not far from the property but parking out front was no issue. As morning hits you may get woken up by dump trucks or traffic. The master bed has a slight dip in it but it was comfortable. Both larger beds were comfy. The showers has great water pressure and plenty of towels. The main thing that I Would suggest for people who are effected by the heat (like MS or other diseases) be sure to bring extra fans. There is one fan at the house. There are air conditioner units. However, we turned them too 64 and it was still rough. The fan and cooler air at night did help. Master bedroom is on the top floor and harder to cool. Just FYI. otherwise, everything was amazing. I would stay here again and suggest cooler air upstairs and maybe at some point...do decor outback. That would be super cute.

Stayed one night
review_text: You can tell when the hosts are really thoughtful, & this is one of those places. Everything is newly renovatedâ€“as nice as a 100+ year old space can be. Street pkg is limited to 2 hrs, but not metered. So u just need to find a spot, which we did within a block or 2 each time. If pkg for > 2 hrs during biz hrs, use the nearby garage or move your car. We just parked on the street. For unloading, we briefly â€œcreatedâ€ a spot out front, out of the way of traffic, so no one cared. Regarding the stairs, we were a bit concerned by other reviews. But they were â€œfineâ€. Would I recommend them to someone with bad knees? No. Were they ok for a couple of days? Yes. Each stair is a little taller, and a little less deep, than a modern stair step, especially to the top floor. We wanted multiple bedrooms and bathrooms, a full kitchen, and a full table, and this place had all those. We had 1 little problem w/ the heat & the host was very responsive, which is all you can ask for. Definitely recommend!!

We absolutely loved Renew at Walnut! The house was immaculate, the beds were super comfortable and the place was well stocked. Itâ€™s super close to lots of great places as well. Sarah was great with communication, and there were lots of helpful tip lists throughout the house, which was appreciated.
Our only complaints were the road noise at all hours of the night- motorcycles and loud cars revving, and garbage trucks at 5am. If youâ€™re used to living in a city, I imagine it may not be a problem. A sound machine also helped tremendously. We stayed at a place just a street over a few years ago and had no problem with street noise, so perhaps itâ€™s a temporary issue.
We didnâ€™t realize there was no off-street parking, which was a bit inconvenient with three young kids. However, you can occasionally snag a spot out front, or on the side, which is metered. Otherwise the parking garage is super close and it wasnâ€™t a huge issue!

review_text: I found Stephanie's listing while wedding planning since I was getting married at the Barn at Silverstone and I'm so happy I did. There is ample parking for us to have a few cars to load/unload our belongings and prepare for the big say. Stephanie was responsive and proactive before our visit. Not only was she so welcoming and helpful, she keeps a beautiful home and the level of cleanliness is up to my standards. The bed was comfortable, the linens were smooth and clean, the space smelled fresh and fragrant, the AC was on yet well insulated & the amentities were updated. The roomes were dust free and had no odor or mold, which is something I find in airbnbs. It had all of the things I needed to prepare a snack or drink coffee, even providing a whoopie pie for us! The design is also calming and stylish, without being over the top. It felt right at home to refresh myself and have quiet time with my husband amidst the busy weekend. If I want a Lancaster getaway, Stephanie's will be my go!

review_text: We had the best stay here and canâ€™t wait to come back! Stephanie was so helpful, kind and welcoming and the place was beautiful, SO CLEAN, and just as described and shown (even better!). The place is very thoughtfully designed and laid out and Stephanie has added many special touches (like moon pie to welcome you which my son gobbled up), coffee and cold drinks, as well as instructions on how to use everything. It was just like staying with family or friends. We loved meeting her and her family and hope to stay here again the next time we visit!

review_text: Cornerstone Cottage is a must for your next stay in Lancaster. This amazing gem is just off the beaten path but right in the middle of all things Lancaster. review_text: Staying at David's Airbnb made our trip extra special and memorable. We were the first to stay in his newly renovated house. The moment we stepped in, my friends and I gasped at how BEAUTIFUL, clean and welcoming the house was. We couldn't stop admiring every room in the house and it's tastefully decorated details. Apart from the exquisite and cosy house, David was a great host and so was Jim! Jim came over to help right away when I had a request. He made us feel extra special when he came over one morning with a box of strawberries. I've stayed in many Airbnbs in the past but this was the best experience yet. Thank you, David and Jim!
